results.title: Thine is the kingdom
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Christianity becomes the religion of the Roman Empire and Palestine becomes a sacred landscape. The Bible and church rituals are decorated with the trappings of Imperial power. The Emperor Constantine becomes the first Christian Emperor of Rome and the division between secular and temporal authority is made more apparent when the concept of the Holy Trinity is adopted in the Nicean Creed. Saint Jerome’s translation of the Bible into Latin from Greek makes it a more accessible text.

results.title: Gospel truth
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
This episode explores the writing of the New Testament looking at the identity of Jesus Christ and his followers, his persecutors and his biographers, the Gospel writers. Also discussed is the gradual spread of Christianity throughout the Roman Empire which escalated once the Gospels became written accounts rather than spread by word of mouth.

results.title: Mightier than the sword
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
The written word became of immense importance to the Jews. During the time of the Babylonian exile to the destruction of Solomon’s temple, the final format of the Old Testament was created. The influence of the Greeks and Romans on Israel is discussed and in particular the role of King Herod the Great who tried to act as a liason between his people and the roman invaders. The Old Testament was finally gathered together in 70 AD however the finding of the Dead Sea Scrolls raises issues about the authorship and history of the Old Teastament.

results.title: Chronicles and kings
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
John Romer explores the archaelogical evidence which accompany the Old Testament books of Kings David and Solomon. The oldest fragment of Bible text, a silver plaque, is dated from this time. The Babylonian conquest of Assyria who had conquered Israel, saw the best part of the Old Testament as we know it, transcribed for posterity.

results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Part one examines the literal truth of the Old Testament, in particular Genesis,by looking at archaelogical evidence found near the ancient sites of Mesopotamia. These ancient cultures with their parallel “biblical” stories are also discussed. In Part two, the story of Exodus is examined by looking at the historical evidence found in Egypt and how the concept of “God” changed from this time.

results.title: Earth revealed
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description: This 26 part series overviews the fields of geology and the earth sciences. Discusses earthquakes, volcanoes, continental drift, the formation of the sea and the Earth’s resources in short but informative episodes.

results.title: Living with earth: preserving the legacy
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The Industrial Revolution changed the way humans exploited the geological richness of the earth and its resources. With problems of global warming and resource depletion, geologists will play a vital role in assisting scientists in harnessing new energy supplies such as geo-thermal energy. The final message of the series is to not only value the earth for its geological history and structure but to safegaurd it for the future.

results.title: Living with earth: the Loma Prieta Earthquake
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Examines human responses to the destructive forces of natural phenomena such as earthquakes. In particular, the San Francisco quake of 1989 is highlighted. Geologists, scientists, engineers and civic planners studied the earthquake and its effects to determine how to better manage a crisis situation given that San Francisco rests on the San Andreas fault line. Although earthquake predicting technology is in its early protype stages, the aim of developing this area will be beneficial in lessening the impact of one natural disaster.

results.title: Waves, beaches & coasts
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Looks at the motion of water particles in a passing wave and how waves are generated by wind. The power of waves shape coastal areas such as bays and headlands. Problems with dredging and the building of sea walls are discussed as well as the creation and effect of devastating seismic waves which result from earthquakes under the sea and on the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television

Looks at the motion of water particles in a passing wave and how waves are generated by wind. The power of waves shape coastal areas such as bays and headlands. Problems with dredging and the building of sea walls are discussed as well as the creation and effect of devastating seismic waves which result from earthquakes under the sea and on the land.
description_for_label:
Episode number 24 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Looks at the motion of water particles in a passing wave and how waves are generated by wind. The power of waves shape coastal areas such as bays and headlands. Problems with dredging and the building of sea walls are discussed as well as the creation and effect of devastating seismic waves which result from earthquakes under the sea and on the land.

results.title: Glaciers
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Presents the properties of glaciers and assesses their importance in sculpting Earth’s surface. The study of glacial movement is important in determining the impact of the Greenhouse Effect. By studying the cyclic nature of Ice Ages, geologists can assist scientists in predicting rising sea levels. There are two types of glaciers; valley glaciers which move from mountains down to valleys and continental glaciers which are single giant ice sheets which accumulate in doems on the surface of the planet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
